project: CXPM AI PRD - Meeting Notes to Requirements
description: Build the first feature of CXPM AI PRD: converting meeting notes into structured requirements that accumulate over time into a coherent Working Requirements document.

userStories.title: Set up FastAPI backend structure
userStories.description: As a developer, I want to set up the FastAPI application structure with CORS configuration so that the frontend can communicate with the backend.
acceptanceCriteria: CORS middleware configured for local development
Health check endpoint available at GET /api/health returning {"status": "ok"}
App runs with uvicorn on port 8000
requirements.txt created with: fastapi, uvicorn[standard], sqlalchemy, alembic, pydantic, pydantic-settings, python-multipart, httpx, anthropic, sse-starlette, markdown, pytest, pytest-asyncio

userStories.title: Create config.py for settings management
userStories.description: As a developer, I want centralized configuration so that all settings are in one place.
acceptanceCriteria: config.py created with pydantic-settings BaseSettings class
Settings class uses env_file='.env' for loading environment variables
.env.example file created documenting all optional environment variables

userStories.title: Configure SQLAlchemy with SQLite database
userStories.description: As a developer, I want to configure SQLAlchemy with SQLite so that data can be persisted locally.
acceptanceCriteria: database.py created with SQLAlchemy engine using DATABASE_URL from config
SessionLocal factory configured with autocommit=False, autoflush=False
Base declarative class created for model inheritance
get_db dependency function yields session and closes after request

userStories.title: Set up Alembic for database migrations
userStories.description: As a developer, I want Alembic configured so that database schema changes can be versioned and applied consistently.
acceptanceCriteria: Alembic initialized in backend directory with alembic init alembic
alembic.ini sqlalchemy.url set to use config DATABASE_URL
env.py imports Base from database.py and sets target_metadata
alembic upgrade head runs without error

userStories.title: Create Project model with migration
userStories.description: As a developer, I want a Project model so that projects can be stored in the database.
acceptanceCriteria: Project model created in models/project.py with id (UUID), name (string, required), description (text, nullable), created_at (datetime), updated_at (datetime)
Model uses SQLAlchemy declarative syntax inheriting from Base
Cascade delete configured: deleting project removes all related meetings, requirements, and their child records
Alembic migration generated and applied creating projects table

userStories.title: Create Pydantic schemas for Project
userStories.description: As a developer, I want Pydantic schemas for Project so that API request/response validation works.
acceptanceCriteria: schemas/project.py created with ProjectCreate (name required, description optional)
ProjectUpdate schema with optional name and description
ProjectResponse schema with all fields including id, created_at, updated_at
ProjectList schema as list of ProjectResponse

userStories.title: Create Project CRUD endpoints
userStories.description: As a user, I want to create, read, update, and delete projects so that I can organize my meeting notes by project.
acceptanceCriteria: POST /api/projects creates project, returns 201 with ProjectResponse
GET /api/projects returns list of all projects

userStories.title: Set up pytest with fixtures
userStories.description: As a developer, I want pytest configured so that I can write and run tests.
acceptanceCriteria: pytest and pytest-asyncio added to requirements.txt
conftest.py created with test_client fixture using TestClient
conftest.py has test_db fixture using in-memory SQLite

userStories.title: Create tests for Project CRUD endpoints
userStories.description: As a developer, I want tests for project CRUD so that I can verify the API works correctly.
acceptanceCriteria: test_projects.py created with test for POST /api/projects
Test for GET /api/projects returns created projects
Test for GET /api/projects/{id} returns 404 for missing project
Test for PUT /api/projects/{id} updates project name

userStories.title: Set up React Router with /app routes
userStories.description: As a user, I want the application to have proper routing so that I can navigate between different pages.
acceptanceCriteria: react-router-dom installed via npm install react-router-dom
Route / renders existing LandingPage and continues to work correctly
Route /app/* catches all app subroutes for future pages
Navigating between / and /app works without page reload
Verify in browser using agent-browser skill: confirm both / and /app routes work
userStories.notes: Manual browser verification needed - no browser testing tools available

userStories.title: Create API service with fetch wrapper
userStories.description: As a developer, I want an API service layer so that all API calls are handled consistently.
acceptanceCriteria: services/api.js created with base URL from VITE_API_URL env var defaulting to http://localhost:8000
get(endpoint) function returns parsed JSON or throws on error
post(endpoint, data) function sends JSON body and returns parsed response
All functions throw Error with message on non-ok response

userStories.title: Create MeetingRecap model with status lifecycle
userStories.description: As a developer, I want a MeetingRecap model so that uploaded meeting notes can be stored with proper status tracking.
acceptanceCriteria: MeetingRecap model created with id (UUID), project_id (FK), title (string), meeting_date (date), raw_input (text), input_type (enum: txt, md)
Status enum created: pending, processing, processed, failed, applied
error_message (text, nullable) and prompt_version (string, nullable) fields
Foreign key to Project with cascade delete (deleting project removes meetings)

userStories.title: Create MeetingItem model
userStories.description: As a developer, I want a MeetingItem model so that extracted items from meetings can be stored before being applied to requirements.
acceptanceCriteria: Section enum created: problems, user_goals, functional_requirements, data_needs, constraints, non_goals, risks_assumptions, open_questions, action_items
MeetingItem model with id (UUID), meeting_id (FK), section (enum), content (text), source_quote (text, nullable), order (int), is_deleted (bool, default false)
Index on (meeting_id, section) for efficient section queries
Foreign key to MeetingRecap with cascade delete

userStories.title: Create Pydantic schemas for Meeting
userStories.description: As a developer, I want Pydantic schemas for Meeting so that API request/response validation works.
acceptanceCriteria: schemas/meeting.py with MeetingUpload (project_id, title, meeting_date, text optional)
MeetingResponse with all fields including status and items list
MeetingItemResponse with section, content, source_quote, order

userStories.title: Create file parser service
userStories.description: As a user, I want to upload .txt and .md files so that my meeting notes can be processed.
acceptanceCriteria: services/parser.py created with parse_file(file: UploadFile) -> str function
Accepts .txt files and returns content as string
Accepts .md files and returns content as string
Raises HTTPException 400 for files over 50KB with message 'File too large. Maximum size is 50KB.'
Raises HTTPException 400 for unsupported file types with message 'Unsupported file type. Use .txt or .md'

userStories.title: Create meeting upload endpoint
userStories.description: As a user, I want an API endpoint to upload meeting notes so that they can be processed.
acceptanceCriteria: POST /api/meetings/upload accepts multipart form with project_id, title, meeting_date, file OR text
Validates project exists, returns 404 if not
Returns {job_id: meeting.id, meeting_id: meeting.id} with status 201
If file provided, uses parser service; if text provided, uses text directly
Router registered in main.py under /api prefix

userStories.title: Create meeting list and get endpoints
userStories.description: As a user, I want to view meetings for a project so that I can see my uploaded notes.
acceptanceCriteria: GET /api/projects/{id}/meetings returns list of meetings for project
GET /api/meetings/{id} returns single meeting with items
Returns 404 if meeting or project not found

userStories.title: Create meeting delete endpoint
userStories.description: As a user, I want to delete meetings so that I can remove unwanted uploads.
acceptanceCriteria: DELETE /api/meetings/{id} removes meeting and associated items

userStories.title: Create LLM provider base class
userStories.description: As a developer, I want an abstract LLM provider interface so that different LLM backends can be used interchangeably.
acceptanceCriteria: services/llm/base.py created with abstract LLMProvider class
Abstract async generator method stream(prompt: str) -> AsyncIterator[str]

userStories.title: Implement Ollama LLM provider
userStories.description: As a user, I want Ollama as the primary LLM backend so that I can use local AI models.
acceptanceCriteria: Connects to OLLAMA_BASE_URL from config (default localhost:11434)
stream() yields chunks from streaming response
Raises LLMError on connection failure with message 'Ollama not available'

userStories.title: Implement Claude LLM provider
userStories.description: As a user, I want Claude as a fallback LLM backend so that AI features work even when Ollama is unavailable.
acceptanceCriteria: Uses anthropic SDK with ANTHROPIC_API_KEY from config
stream() yields chunks from streaming response
Raises LLMError 'Claude API key not configured' if key missing

userStories.title: Create LLM factory with fallback logic
userStories.description: As a developer, I want automatic fallback from Ollama to Claude so that AI features are resilient.
acceptanceCriteria: Tries Ollama first by calling /api/tags health check
Falls back to Claude if Ollama unavailable
Raises LLMError 'No LLM available. Please start Ollama or configure Claude API key.' if both fail

userStories.title: Create meeting extraction prompt
userStories.description: As a developer, I want a versioned prompt for extracting structured items from meeting notes.
acceptanceCriteria: Prompt instructs LLM to extract items into 9 sections: problems, user_goals, functional_requirements, data_needs, constraints, non_goals, risks_assumptions, open_questions, action_items
Prompt includes clear instructions for handling edge cases: empty notes, unclear content, non-English text
Prompt requests source_quote to contain the original text that led to the extraction
Prompt handles various meeting note formats (bullet points, paragraphs, headers)

userStories.title: Create extractor service
userStories.description: As a developer, I want an extractor service that processes meeting notes with LLM.
acceptanceCriteria: services/extractor.py with extract(meeting_id: UUID, db: Session) function
On malformed LLM output, auto-retries once before failing
On timeout, auto-retries once before failing
Parses JSON response into MeetingItem records
Updates meeting status to processed on success
Updates meeting status to failed with error_message on failure

userStories.title: Create chunking service for long inputs
userStories.description: As a user, I want long meeting notes automatically chunked so that they can be processed without hitting context limits.
acceptanceCriteria: services/chunker.py with chunk_text(text: str, max_chars: int = 4000) -> list[str]
Splits by double newlines (paragraphs) preserving boundaries
Keeps any section headers (lines starting with # or ##) with each chunk for context

userStories.title: Integrate chunking into extractor
userStories.description: As a user, I want the extractor to handle long inputs by chunking.
acceptanceCriteria: If so, chunks input and processes each chunk separately
Deduplicates exact match items by content

userStories.title: Add streaming to extractor service
userStories.description: As a user, I want streaming output from extraction so I see results as they are extracted.
acceptanceCriteria: extract_stream(meeting_id: UUID, db: Session) async generator function added
Yields individual MeetingItem dicts as they are parsed
Updates meeting status to processing at start
Updates meeting status to processed when complete

userStories.title: Create SSE streaming endpoint
userStories.description: As a user, I want to connect to a streaming endpoint so that I receive extraction results in real-time.
acceptanceCriteria: GET /api/meetings/{job_id}/stream returns SSE stream using EventSourceResponse
Emits {type: 'item', data: {section, content, source_quote}} for each item

userStories.title: Create tests for extractor service
userStories.description: As a developer, I want tests for the extractor so that I can verify AI integration works correctly.
acceptanceCriteria: Test status transitions from pending to processing to processed
Test malformed LLM output sets status to failed

userStories.title: Create tests for chunker service
userStories.description: As a developer, I want tests for the chunker so that I can verify long input handling works.
acceptanceCriteria: test_chunker.py with test for text under limit (single chunk)
Test for text over limit (multiple chunks)

Test that paragraph boundaries are preserved

userStories.title: Create tests for SSE streaming endpoint
userStories.description: As a developer, I want tests for the streaming endpoint so that I can verify SSE works correctly.
acceptanceCriteria: Test that status event is emitted first
Test that item events are emitted for each extraction
Test that complete event is emitted with correct count
Test that error event is emitted on failure

userStories.title: Create useStreaming hook for SSE
userStories.description: As a developer, I want a React hook for consuming SSE streams so that components can easily display streaming data.
acceptanceCriteria: Hook takes jobId parameter and returns {items, status, error, retry}
Adds items to array as 'item' events arrive
Handles EventSource onerror: sets error state with user-friendly message
Handles connection timeout (30 seconds with no events) by setting error state
Provides retry function to reconnect after error

acceptanceCriteria: Each requirement item shows source meeting link(s)
Multiple sources shown as comma-separated links
Verify in browser using agent-browser skill

userStories.title: Create HistoryPopover component
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see requirement change history so that I can understand how it evolved.
acceptanceCriteria: History icon on each requirement item
Popover fetches and shows history from GET /api/requirements/{id}/history
Shows actor, action, and content changes for each entry

userStories.title: Add Markdown export button to RequirementsPage
userStories.description: As a user, I want an export button so that I can download the requirements as Markdown.
acceptanceCriteria: 'Export as Markdown' button visible in page header
Verify in browser using agent-browser skill

userStories.title: Create tests for RequirementsPage
userStories.description: As a developer, I want tests for the requirements page so that I can verify viewing and editing works correctly.

userStories.title: Create MeetingItemDecision model
userStories.description: As a developer, I want a MeetingItemDecision model so that all decisions during apply are recorded for audit.
acceptanceCriteria: Decision enum: added, skipped_duplicate, skipped_semantic, conflict_keep_existing, conflict_replaced, conflict_kept_both, conflict_merged
MeetingItemDecision model with id (UUID), meeting_item_id (FK), decision (enum), matched_requirement_id (FK, nullable), reason (text, nullable)

userStories.title: Create conflict classification prompt
userStories.description: As a developer, I want a prompt for classifying conflicts so that the LLM can identify duplicates and conflicts.
acceptanceCriteria: Input format: existing requirement content and new item content
Prompt handles edge cases like partial overlaps

userStories.title: Create conflict detection service
userStories.description: As a user, I want the system to detect duplicates and conflicts when applying meeting items.
acceptanceCriteria: services/conflict.py with detect_conflicts(meeting_id: UUID, db: Session) function
Exact text match detection skips duplicates immediately
For non-exact matches, calls LLM with classify_conflict prompt
Each result includes item, decision type, and reason

userStories.title: Create merge suggestion prompt
userStories.description: As a developer, I want a prompt for suggesting merged text so that conflicts can be resolved.
acceptanceCriteria: Input format: existing requirement content and new item content
Output format: single string with merged content
Prompt preserves important details from both inputs

userStories.title: Create merge suggestion service
userStories.description: As a user, I want AI-suggested merged text for conflicts so that I can easily combine requirements.
acceptanceCriteria: services/merger.py with suggest_merge(existing: str, new: str) -> str function
Uses LLM factory to get provider
Raises error gracefully if LLM fails

userStories.title: Create apply endpoint
userStories.description: As a user, I want an API endpoint to apply meeting items with conflict detection.
acceptanceCriteria: Does NOT create requirements yet (that happens in resolve)
Returns 400 if meeting status is not processed

userStories.title: Create merge suggestion endpoint
userStories.description: As a user, I want an API endpoint to get merge suggestions for conflicts.
acceptanceCriteria: POST /api/meetings/suggest-merge accepts existing and new text
Returns 500 with error message if LLM fails

userStories.title: Create resolve endpoint
userStories.description: As a user, I want an API endpoint to resolve conflicts and create requirements.
acceptanceCriteria: Each decision has item_id, decision type, and optional merged_text
Creates requirements for added items with is_active=true
Records all decisions in MeetingItemDecision table
Updates RequirementHistory for all changes with actor=ai_extraction or ai_merge
Creates RequirementSource entries linking requirement to meeting and meeting_item
RequirementSource includes source_quote from the original MeetingItem
Updates meeting status to applied and sets applied_at timestamp
Returns success with counts: {added: N, skipped: M, merged: P, replaced: Q}

userStories.title: Create tests for conflict detection service
userStories.description: As a developer, I want tests for conflict detection so that I can verify the logic works correctly.
acceptanceCriteria: test_conflict.py with test for exact match detection
Test for LLM classification with mocked responses

userStories.title: Create tests for merge suggestion service
userStories.description: As a developer, I want tests for merge suggestions so that I can verify they work correctly.
acceptanceCriteria: test_merger.py with test for successful merge suggestion

userStories.title: Create tests for apply/resolve endpoints
userStories.description: As a developer, I want tests for apply and resolve endpoints so that I can verify the flow works correctly.
acceptanceCriteria: test_apply.py with test for apply endpoint returning categorized items
Test for resolve endpoint creating requirements
Test for decision recording in MeetingItemDecision
Test for history recording in RequirementHistory
Test for RequirementSource creation linking to meeting and meeting_item
Test for status transition to applied with applied_at timestamp

acceptanceCriteria: Summary header shows counts: 'X items will be added, Y duplicates skipped, Z conflicts need review'

Skipped duplicates section expandable with reason shown
Shows loading state during API call
